0: Prepare and process import and export documentation according to customs regulations, laws, or procedures.
Clear goods through customs and to their destinations for clients.
Pay, or arrange for payment of, taxes and duties on shipments.
Calculate duty and tariff payments owed on shipments.
Request or compile necessary import documentation, such as customs invoices, certificates of origin, and cargo-control documents.
Classify goods according to tariff coding system.
Stay abreast of changes in import or export laws or regulations by reading current literature, attending meetings or conferences, or conferring with colleagues.
Sign documents on behalf of clients, using powers of attorney.
Advise customers on import and export restrictions, tariff systems, insurance requirements, quotas, or other customs-related matters.
Post bonds for the products being imported or assist clients in obtaining bonds.
Quote duty and tax rates on goods to be imported, based on federal tariffs and excise taxes.
Arrange for transportation, warehousing, or product distribution of imported or exported products.
Monitor or trace the location of goods.
Confer with officials in various agencies to facilitate clearance of goods through customs and quarantine.
Inform importers and exporters of steps to reduce duties and taxes.
Obtain line releases for frequent shippers of low-risk commodities, high-volume entries, or multiple-container loads.
Provide advice on transportation options, types of carriers, or shipping routes.
Contract with freight forwarders for destination services.
Apply for tariff concessions or for duty drawbacks and other refunds.
Insure cargo against loss, damage, or pilferage.
Prepare papers for shippers to appeal duty charges.
1: Analyze training needs to develop new training programs or modify and improve existing programs.
Evaluate instructor performance and the effectiveness of training programs, providing recommendations for improvement.

Plan, develop, and provide training and staff development programs, using knowledge of the effectiveness of methods such as classroom training, demonstrations, on-the-job training, meetings, conferences, and workshops.
Confer with management and conduct surveys to identify training needs based on projected production processes, changes, and other factors.
Conduct orientation sessions and arrange on-the-job training for new hires.
Train instructors and supervisors in techniques and skills for training and dealing with employees.
Develop and organize training manuals, multimedia visual aids, and other educational materials.
Prepare training budget for department or organization.
Develop testing and evaluation procedures.
Conduct or arrange for ongoing technical training and personal development classes for staff members.
Review and evaluate training and apprenticeship programs for compliance with government standards.
2: Monitor and record food temperatures to ensure food safety.
Cook foodstuffs according to menus, special dietary or nutritional restrictions, or numbers of portions to be served.
Rotate and store food supplies.
Wash pots, pans, dishes, utensils, or other cooking equipment.
Apportion and serve food to facility residents, employees, or patrons.
Clean and inspect galley equipment, kitchen appliances, and work areas to ensure cleanliness and functional operation.
Clean, cut, and cook meat, fish, or poultry.
Direct activities of one or more workers who assist in preparing and serving meals.
Train new employees.
Take inventory of supplies and equipment.
Requisition food supplies, kitchen equipment, and appliances, based on estimates of future needs.
Bake breads, rolls, or other pastries.

0: Verifies shipments to ensure compliance with customs regulations.
Analyzes commercial invoices for accuracy and completeness.
Communicates with importers and exporters on shipping requirements.
Prepares and submits necessary documentation for customs clearance.
Interprets and applies relevant laws, regulations, and policies.
Conducts thorough research on shipment details to avoid delays.
Coordinates with carriers and transportation providers to expedite delivery.
Updates records to reflect changes in shipment status or status of release.
Negotiates on behalf of clients for reduction in duties and taxes.
Ensures compliance with customs seals, labels, and marking requirements.
Monitors shipments through customs ports and warehouses for timely arrival.
Responds to inquiries from customs agencies and regulatory bodies.
Develops and implements procedures to improve operational efficiency.
Travels internationally to attend meetings and resolve issues at client sites.
Participates in trade missions and industry conferences to promote business development.
Collaborates with logistics providers to optimize supply chain operations.
Maintains accurate records of shipments, including inventory levels and status.
Identifies potential risks and implements strategies to mitigate them.
Provides training and support to new staff members on customs regulations.
Develops and maintains relationships with key stakeholders in the industry.

1: Develop and implement a comprehensive employee training program to enhance workplace skills and knowledge.
Design and deliver instructor-led training sessions for new hires, sales teams, and other departments as needed.
Conduct needs assessments to identify skill gaps and determine the most effective training methods.
Collaborate with subject matter experts to create customized training content and materials.
Manage and track training program evaluations and outcomes to ensure continuous improvement.
Coordinate logistics and resources for training events, including venue selection, catering, and equipment rental.
Create and maintain up-to-date job descriptions and learning objectives to align with organizational goals.
Establish and enforce training policies and procedures to ensure consistency and efficiency.
Develop and distribute training materials, such as manuals, handouts, and online courses.
Provide on-the-job coaching and mentoring to support new hires and employees in their professional development.
Facilitate workshops and seminars to promote employee engagement, teamwork, and organizational culture.

Prepare ingredients according to recipes, measuring and chopping vegetables, meat, and seasonings accurately.
Cook pasta, rice, or other grains according to institutional guidelines to ensure food is cooked evenly and safely.
Maintain a clean and organized kitchen environment by washing equipment, utensils, and countertops regularly.
Operate commercial kitchen equipment such as ovens, stoves, and refrigerators safely and efficiently.
Develop and implement menu plans that cater to diverse dietary needs and preferences for institutional or cafeteria settings.
Monitor food quality and presentation, making adjustments as necessary to ensure dishes meet established standards.
Follow proper food safety protocols, including handling, storage, and disposal of ingredients and leftovers safely.
Assist in ordering supplies and inventory management to maintain kitchen efficiency and minimize waste.
Collaborate with colleagues to coordinate menu planning, food preparation, and serving during peak periods or events.
Prepare and package institutional meals according to established guidelines and recipes to ensure consistency and quality.
Perform regular equipment maintenance and cleaning to prevent breakdowns and maintain kitchen hygiene standards.
